subsections.title: Beginnings in 2015
subsections.content: OpenAI was founded in December 2015 by a group of influential entrepreneurs and researchers, including Elon Musk, Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, Wojciech Zaremba, and John Schulman. The organization was established as a non-profit research lab with a mission to ensure that artificial general intelligence (AGI) benefits all of humanity.

subsections.title: Core Mission and Principles
subsections.content: From the outset, OpenAI’s mission has been centered on the responsible development of AI. Their principles emphasized collaborative research, open sharing of knowledge, and the development of safe and beneficial artificial intelligence technologies.

subsections.title: Major Technological Breakthroughs
subsections.content: OpenAI has introduced several groundbreaking AI models over the years. Early achievements include OpenAI Gym (2016), a toolkit for developing and testing reinforcement learning algorithms, and advancements like Dota 2-playing models. The company gained significant attention with the development of the GPT series, starting from GPT-2 in 2019 to the advanced GPT-3 in 2020, revolutionizing natural language processing.

subsections.title: Transition to a 'Capped-Profit' Model
subsections.content: In 2019, OpenAI transformed into a 'capped-profit' organization, OpenAI LP, to attract funding while staying true to its mission. This change allowed OpenAI to scale its operations and develop cutting-edge AI systems while ensuring sustainable profit limits.

subsections.title: Partnerships and Integrations
subsections.content: OpenAI has worked with technology giants, including a significant partnership with Microsoft, which invested over $10 billion in OpenAI by 2023. This collaboration has supported cloud computing infrastructure and the development of tools like ChatGPT, making AI more accessible worldwide.
